content.raw:
I got no objection to merge this in your version of getAny. I proposed this because I find it much simpler that getAny that use boost::any and the other Get that use std::pair<T, bool>. Both use an exotic variable when we can just get the value we want in one call ! 
Or maybe I miss something in the usage of boost::any, but I see that as an extra step to get your value when template directly give you the good ouput
Do you want me to open PR on your PR to change that ?

Both use an exotic variable when we can just get the value we want in one call ! Or maybe I miss something in the usage of boost::any, but I see that as an extra step to get your value when template directly give you the good ouput Do you want me to open PR on your PR to change that ?
